intro: Chaetospora turbinata, commonly known as the spiral-sheath moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, spiral-shaped leaves that are often twisted around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks. Chaetospora turbinata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms in its ecosystem.
